text: Junior Wells (Amos Wells Blakemore Jr.; December 9, 1934January 15, 1998), born Amos Wells Blakemore Jr.,Thedeadrockstarsclub.com - accessed May 2009 was an American Chicago blues vocalist, harmonica player, and recording artist. Wells was best known for his performances and recordings with Muddy Waters, Earl Hooker and Buddy Guy. He also performed with Bonnie Raitt, The Rolling Stones, and Van Morrison. Wells was born Amos Wells Blakemore Jr. on December 9, 1934 in Memphis, Tennessee. He was raised in West Memphis, Arkansas. Wells continued performing until he was diagnosed with cancer in the summer of 1997. That fall, he suffered a heart attack while undergoing treatment, sending him into a coma. Wells died in Chicago, Illinois from lymphoma on January 15, 1998, and was interred in the Oak Woods Cemetery, Greater Grand Crossing, Chicago. ==References== ==Other websites== * Centerstage Chicago Obituary * * Elvis Pelvis Obituary * Island Net Obituary Category:1934 births Category:1998 deaths Category:Deaths from lymphoma Category:Cancer deaths in Chicago Category:Burials at Oak Woods Cemetery Category:Chicago blues musicians Category:Singers from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Musicians from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Singers from Arkansas Category:Musicians from Arkansas
